abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is highly satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial, Bank
            performance is satisfactory, and Borrower performance is
            highly satisfactory. Among the lessons suggested by the
            project experience are the following: 1) Careful poverty
            targeting and sensitive project design can lead to major
            poverty reduction impacts even under difficult post-disaster
            circumstances. 2) Relocation of villages that consists
            mostly of one and two story buildings during post-earthquake
            reconstruction is usually a mistake in the long-term. 3)
            Simplicity of message is essential to the adoption of
            disaster-resistant technologies. 4) Grievance procedures
            need to be in place from the outset. 5) Damage Assessments
            need criteria that are carefully tailored to each widely
            used construction type, and that lead to damage awards
            closely tied to the actual cost of what needs to be done. 6)
            Owner-driven construction was more effective in providing
            culturally and environmentally appropriate housing given the
            limited range o f options contractors were able to provide
            for the same cost.
